column5: i have an abu ambassador 5501c3 on it so far and its getting tired,. I do like the balance but I feel the reel is a little small for my likings. Esp targeting skis.  Replacing the reel with the same model would be ideal since i will have spare parts for it, but like I said i think the reel is a little small for those big feirce fish. I also dont want to be braking the bank either. Any ideas would be greatly appreciated Thanks in advance  v

I like my Abu big game 7000 I picked it up last summer for $149 in the US I still have my old 7000 but like the new one better it has off set gears and power handle.  The 7000's are bigger then you 5501.
Vince, what do you plan on doing with it? Is it an all-around Muskie rod that you plan on casting and trolling with? Or is it technique specific, like to be used for Jerkbaits?
Dax has the right question. Can't help much without knowing that.
Casting & possibly trolling, so an all round reel would be great.
The Calcutta 400B is a great duel purpose reel but might be a little more money than you'd like to part with.

Since you'll be trolling with it a clicker is a likely must have feature...A Calcutta 400B is good choice, as is a Daiwa Luna 300, both are over $200 though...But well worth the money. A St.Croix Avid AC300 is about $225, exact same as a discontinued Daiwa Millionaire CV-Z 300, which is a bombproof reel! And very similar to the Luna and Calcutta 400B. I'd suggest spending a bit more and never worrying about replacing it.
get a 6501 c3, it'll be a good all 'round reel without breaking the bank.  the clicker is loud and it's a solid reel.
